p: P. oryzae hyphae secrete effectors that suppress plant defense responses for successful colonization in rice cells [ 30, 38, 39]. If ROS focal accumulation inhibits P. oryzae hyphal growth and inhibits effector expression, it would be a much more effective defense mechanism. To investigate effector expression during P. oryzae infection process, the effector BAS4:eGFP was constructed and transformed into P. oryzae INA168. The BAS4:eGFP effector was normally expressed in P. oryzae invasive hyphae in compatible interaction with NB sheath epidermal cells ( Figure 3A). By contrast, no fluorescence was detected in incompatible HY cells inoculated with avirulent P. oryzae INA168: BAS4:eGFP ( Figure 3A).
